Most Helpful Customer Reviews

12 of 12 people found the following review helpful
Cabin Porn!
By Mike Grant on September 9, 2014
Format: Hardcover
If you dream of getting out of society to a house nestled in the great outdoors, this book is a beautiful collection of inspiration. More of an art book than a building guide, such as Your Cabin in the Woods, you are sure to be impressed by the gorgeous image quality and international survey of ideas. There's a garage that was turned into a glass house, a mobile sauna, and an egg-like shelter inspired by the architecture of nomadic people that make this book a must-see!
Comment Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Sending feedback...
Thank you for your feedback. If this review is inappropriate, please let us know.

... be more secluded cabins and hideouts but it's mostly super expensive architects homes
By Akil Harris on January 6, 2015
Format: Hardcover Verified Purchase
Thought this was going to be more secluded cabins and hideouts but it's mostly super expensive architects homes.

4 of 4 people found the following review helpful
" You'll be highly disappointed if you are looking for cabins in the traditional ...
By Michael Weber on February 9, 2015
Format: Hardcover Verified Purchase
The book's cover is labeled with the word "Cabins." You'll be highly disappointed if you are looking for cabins in the traditional use of the word. These are multi-million dollar cabins set in beautiful settings but are far from the word "cabin" that I am used to. Although the print quality and images are beautiful, had I been able to see a few interior pages, I would not have purchased this book online.
Comment Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Sending feedback...
Thank you for your feedback. If this review is inappropriate, please let us know.
Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again
3 of 3 people found the following review helpful
Should be called cabins for millionaires
By Baja James on January 30, 2015
Format: Hardcover
Should be called cabins for millionaires. the pictures are beautiful however they are very limited for each property and there are no floor plans. Most of the structures are architectural experiments cost 100s of thousands of dollars to build. I was disappointed in that aspect of the books. There more practical books such as Huts and Hideaways and others that fill this need much better. But if yo are looking for a coffee table books this might work for you. For practical ideas no.
Comment Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Sending feedback...
Thank you for your feedback. If this review is inappropriate, please let us know.
Sorry, we failed to record your vote. Please try again
3 of 3 people found the following review helpful
Fun coffee table book of interesting cabins
By R. T. Bergman on October 22, 2014
Format: Hardcover Verified Purchase
Fun coffee table book of interesting cabins. My wife and I dream of building one someday, and there are great ideas here.

2 of 2 people found the following review helpful
A fairy tale of a book
By Birn on November 19, 2014
Format: Hardcover Verified Purchase
Elegantly illustrated and cleanly designed. Astounding structures in magnificent settings. Not much text, but the pictures make up for it … almost. If you've ever wanted to build a place in the country or simply fantasize about doing so, get this book.
